definitions.definition: Excessive activity, worry, bother, or talk about something.
definitions.example: They made a big fuss about the wedding plans.

definitions.definition: A complaint or noise; a scene.
definitions.example: If you make enough of a fuss about the problem, maybe they'll fix it for you.

definitions.definition: An exhibition of affection or admiration.
definitions.example: They made a great fuss over the new baby.

definitions.definition: To be very worried or excited about something, often too much.
definitions.example: His grandmother will never quit fussing over his vegetarianism.

definitions.definition: To fiddle; fidget; wiggle, or adjust
definitions.example: Quit fussing with your hair. It looks fine.

definitions.definition: (especially of babies) To cry or be ill-humoured.
(with over) To show affection for, especially animals.
